data.text:
@DziaShots @HiDearzaki You're not seeing less deaths in the vaxxed population per capita, that's the point!

The percentage of people dying vaccinated is higher than the percentage of the population vaxxed people comprise. If it was effective, the numbers would present the opposite!

@dialucrii31 @HiDearzaki You are actually delusional. What we are seeing is less deaths overall in the population so per capita vaccines save more lives compared to when we didn’t have it. Also when we had high spikes most people were unvaxx until now where so many are vaxd that it’s the vaxxed that die

@DziaShots @HiDearzaki covid death population to be similar or HIGHER than the proportion of the population who are vaxxed.

If you can't grasp that, I can't help you.

@DziaShots @HiDearzaki 🤣🤣Go away and think about it. I laid it out pretty clearly.

Yes, if more people in the population are vaxxed than unvaxxed, you MIGHT expect that number to be higher (unless they prevented all deaths). What you would  not expect, is for the PROPORTION of vaxxed deaths in the

@dialucrii31 @HiDearzaki You aren’t doing a per capita comparison. Of course there’s more total deaths for the vaccine side there are more vaccinated people. When you do it per capita it’s clear that the people who die are the unvaccinated.

@DziaShots @davestwittylife @HiDearzaki It's  the official deaths data from the UK government. The scottish government were issuing the vaxxed/unvaxxed death numbers until last week, but now that the numbers don't suit the narrative, they've stopped breaking it down by vaxxed status.
@DziaShots @HiDearzaki a faster rate than the unvaxxed.

@DziaShots @HiDearzaki That's essentially what we are seeing - vaxxed are 90% of total deaths and unvaxxed are 10% of total deaths, suggesting that the vaccine is now pretty useless at preventing deaths. If it wasn't, we'd expect to see the vaxxed percentage of total deaths at something far below 90%.
@DziaShots @HiDearzaki Because the distribution of vaxxed deaths would be the same as the distribution of vaxxed among the population, roughly speaking.
